note: 两年前宣布的是OpenPower Microwatt作为基于FPGA的软CPU核心。   此开源软处理器核心符合电源ISA 3.0指令集，可以在各种FPGA硬件上运行。 Microwatt标志着使用Open Power ISA 3.0规范从头开始写的第一个处理器，并用作组织和＃39; S参考设计之一。虽然基本的设计和迎合FPGA使用，但它将今年去看130nm芯片制作，如果一切顺利。   无论如何，今天的新闻是即将到来的Linux 5.14被设置为增加对微波的支持。   在PowerPC-Next内排队是Microwatt平台支持，Microwatt DeviceTree以及用于启用OpenPower Microwatt支持的各种其他贴片。    这种初始支持足以处理Microwatt的FPGA实现，而补丁确实重申平台的早期状态，尚未拥有任何SMP，VMX，VSX，事务存储器或具有成熟电源硬件的其他功能。   可以通过GitHub找到以VHDL写入的微型来源。
note_en: Announced two years ago was the  OpenPOWER Microwatt as an FPGA-based soft CPU core.    This open-source soft processor core complies with the Power ISA 3.0 instruction set and can be run on various FPGA hardware. Microwatt marks the first processor written from scratch using the open Power ISA 3.0 specification and serves as one of the organization's reference designs. While a basic design and catered for FPGA usage,  it's going to see 130nm chip fabrication this year if all goes well.   In any case, the news today is that the forthcoming  Linux 5.14 is set to add support for the Microwatt.   Queued within  powerpc-next is the Microwatt platform support, the MicroWatt DeviceTree, and various other patches for enabling the OpenPOWER Microwatt support.     This initial support is good enough for handling FPGA implementations of Microwatt while the patches do reiterate the early state of the platform with not yet having any SMP, VMX, VSX, transactional memory, or other features found with mature POWER hardware.   The Microwatt sources written in VHDL can be found via  GitHub.
title: Linux 5.14支持OpenPower Microwatt软CPU核心
title_en: Linux 5.14 to Support the OpenPOWER Microwatt Soft CPU Core

note:
它＆＃39;官员。 Andreessen Horowitz  - 由Ben Horowitz和Marc Andreessen领导的突出风险投资基金 - 周四宣布其第三个加密风险基金的收盘，该公司表示的基金为22亿美元，这是其最大的基金。
  ＆＃34;最大的加密基金迄今为止，Crypto Fund III是生态系统的验证时刻，另一个迹象，Crypto成为我们金融基础设施的更多主流部分，＆＃34;该公司在新闻稿中表示。
 近几个月举办了促进了兆基金的Andreessen Horowitz（也称为A16Z）的谣言。 4月份的金融时报报告称，加利福尼亚州的投资公司将为加密基金筹集10亿美元。 5月下旬，Tech Blogger Eric Newcomer写道，该公司筹集了20亿美元。
 熟悉加剧的消息人士现在告诉这些街区，兴趣来自公司的有限合作伙伴，并在以前的加密资金中有大量回报。根据Coindesk的说法，A16Z在交易所在纳斯达克首次亮相之后，销售乐队股票净额超过4.4亿美元。
 Crypto的A16z＆＃39的任务是广泛的，从分散金融（DECI）到比特币应用程序到所谓的网络3，或互联网的分散版本。公司＆＃39; S组合包括褶边实验室，Celo，Unisap和近。
   ＆＃34;此基金使我们能够找到下一代Visionary Crypto创始人，并投资于Crypto的最令人兴奋的地区，＆＃34;迪克森和豪伦在博客文章中写道。 ＆＃34;我们投资所有阶段，从早期的种子阶段项目完全开发出后期网络。＆＃34;
 除了获得超过20亿美元的投资加入加密，A16z＆＃39; Crypto业务一直在积极招聘。它使包括Anthony Albanese在内的一些关键员工，他去年加入了纽约证券交易所的公司。阿尔巴尼人现在正在推向A16z Crypto的首席运营官。 
该公司还聘请了证券交易委员会的前任董事Bill Hinman，他曾经说过以太（Eth）不是安全，而Rachael Horowitz是一位退伍军人硅Vally通信策略家，他们最近也是Coinbase的Top Communicator加入了。 Horowitz还在推特，谷歌和Facebook上担任职位。
 额外的新雇员包括政策制造商Tomicah Tilleman，他在担任乔·拜登总统的高级顾问后加入公司作为全球政策负责人。
 ＆＃34;与任何新的计算运动一样，Crypto曾遭受过各种挑战和误解，＆＃34;迪克森和郝顺说。 ＆＃34;这就是为什么我们也在跨越几个职能中汇集重型劫持者来帮助将“Crypto”转换为主流。＆＃34;
  Crypto Fund III的宣布遵循了Crypto Venture投资中最近的活动。尽管硬币价格下滑，但投资者一直在提高大笔现金来倒入新的加密初创公司。
 框架企业最近宣布了1亿美元的新基金投资于污染。同时，区块链资本最近宣布了新的3亿美元基金，与科技巨头PayPal和签证的支持。
 该块的数据显示投资者在2021年期间投入超过88亿美元的初创公司，而2020年的全部增加30.7亿。
    ©2021 Block Crypto，Inc。保留所有权利。本文仅供参考。它没有提供或打算用作合法，税收，投资，财务或其他建议。
note_en:
It's official. Andreessen Horowitz — the prominent venture capital fund led by Ben Horowitz and Marc Andreessen — announced Thursday the close of its third crypto venture fund, a $2.2 billion fund that the firm says is the largest of its kind.
  "The largest crypto fund ever raised to date, Crypto Fund III is a validating moment for the ecosystem and another sign that crypto becoming an ever more mainstream part of our financial infrastructure," the firm said in a press release.
 Rumors of Andreessen Horowitz (also known as a16z) raising a mega-fund have appeared in various reports in recent months. The Financial Times reported in April that the California-based investment firm would be raising $1 billion for a crypto fund. In late May, tech blogger Eric Newcomer wrote that the firm was raising $2 billion.
 A source familiar with the raise now told The Block that interest came mostly from limited partners in the firm's previous crypto funds, which have seen large returns. a16z netted more than $440 million from selling Coinbase stock soon after the exchange made its public markets debut on Nasdaq, according to CoinDesk.
 a16z's mandate in crypto has been broad, ranging from decentralized finance (DeFi) to bitcoin applications to so-called Web 3, or a decentralized version of the internet. The firm's portfolio includes Dapper Labs, Celo, Uniswap, and Near.
   "This fund allows us to find the next generation of visionary crypto founders, and invest in the  most exciting areas of crypto," Dixon and Haun wrote in a blog post. "We invest in all stages, from early seed-stage projects to fully developed later-stage networks."
 In addition to securing more than $2 billion to invest in crypto, a16z's crypto business has been hiring aggressively. It has made a number of key hires including Anthony Albanese, who joined the firm last year from the New York Stock Exchange. Albanese is now being promoted to chief operating officer of a16z crypto.
 The firm also hired Bill Hinman, a former director at the Securities and Exchange Commission, who once said ether (ETH) is not a security, and Rachael Horowitz, a veteran Silicon Vally communications strategist who previously was the top communicator at Coinbase, also recently joined. Horowitz has also held positions at Twitter, Google, and Facebook.
 Additional new hires include policymaker Tomicah Tilleman, who is joining the firm as global head of policy after serving as a senior advisor to President Joe Biden.
 "As with any new computing movement, crypto has endured a variety of challenges and misconceptions," Dixon and Haun said. "That’s why we are also bringing together heavy-hitters across several functions to help translate “crypto” to the mainstream."
  The announcement of Crypto Fund III follows a flurry of recent activity in crypto venture investing. Despite the slump in coin prices, investors have been raising large sums of cash to pour into new crypto startups.
 Framework Ventures recently announced a $100 million new fund to invest in DeFi. Blockchain Capital, meanwhile, recently announced  a new $300 million fund with backing from tech giants PayPal and Visa.
 Data from The Block shows investors poured more than $8.8 billion into startups during 2021, compared with 3.07 billion in all of 2020.
    © 2021 The Block Crypto, Inc. All Rights Reserved. This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.
title: “最大的Crypto基金：”A16z推出了新的2.2B美元加密风险基金
title_en: 'Largest crypto fund ever:' A16Z launches new $2.2B crypto venture fund

note:
“我们计划继续与网络社区合作，为关键领域创建更多的私人方法，包括广告测量，提供相关的广告和内容以及欺诈检测，”它写道。 “今天，Chrome和其他人提供了30多个提案，其中四个提案可以在原产地试验中获得。
 “对于Chrome，特别是，我们的目标是让2022年底部署的关键技术为开发人员社区开始采用它们。根据我们与英国的竞争和市场竞争权（CMA）的参与，并根据我们提供的承诺，Chrome可以在三个月内逐步逐步淘汰第三方饼干，从2023年中期开始，并于2023年后结束。“
  延迟使Adtech Industry更多的时间适应跟踪后饼干在线领域 - 假设CMA很乐意让谷歌继续重新滑动。
  Adtech Giant Google似乎倾向于推迟第三方跟踪饼干的长期计划弃用。
 该计划日期返回2019年，当时它宣布了长期倡议，这将使在线营销人员和广告商更难跟踪Web用户，包括弃用Chrome中的第三方Cookie。
 然后，在2020年1月，它表示它将在两年内切换。这将是2022年的意思。
  谷歌证实了TechCrunch，它今天有一个隐私沙盒公告 - 设置为4PM BST / 5PM CET  - 我们联系以便通过我们自己的来源要求确认我们所听到的信息。 
我们已被告知谷歌的新官方时间表以2023年。
 然而，科技巨头的发言人围绕提供直接确认 - 说“更新”很快就是收入。
 “我们今天有一个公告将在隐私沙箱更新中阐明一些亮点，”发言人也告诉我们。
 他已经回复了我们的初始电子邮件 - 已要求谷歌确认它将推迟实施隐私沙箱到2023;对于延迟的任何陈述 - 肯定（“是的”）所以，好吧，延迟看起来很可能。但我们会看到谷歌如何旋转，即在发布传入的隐私沙盒通知时在几分钟内旋转。
 谷歌此前表示，它将支持2022年对第三方饼干的支持 - 它自然意味着相关的Adtech的更广泛的隐私沙箱堆栈还需要到达。
 今年早些时候，它略微落后于2022年的时间表，在1月份说，在2022年之前不会进行任何变化。
 谷歌的问题是，其计划的监管审查已经加强了Adtech Industry的反托拉斯投诉，这对其如何跟踪和定位互联网用户的巨大变更。 
在欧洲，英国的竞争和市场管理局一直在与英国的信息专员办公室合作，了解谷歌计划举动的竞争和隐私机构。 而且，本月早些时候，CMA发布了有意接受谷歌的拟议承诺的通知，该承诺将使监管机构能够阻止任何折旧饼干，如果它不满足，可以以适合竞争和隐私的方式完成。  当时我们问谷歌CMA的参与可能会影响隐私沙箱时间表，但公司拒绝发表评论。  提高大型技术的监管监督将有大量的影响 - 最显然这意味着谷歌这样的巨人的机会的结束是“快速打破东西”。
note_en:
“We plan to continue to work with the web community to create more private approaches to key areas, including ad measurement, delivering relevant ads and content, and fraud detection,” it writes. “Today, Chrome and others have offered more than 30 proposals, and four of those proposals are available in origin trials.
 “For Chrome, specifically, our goal is to have the key technologies deployed by late 2022 for the developer community to start adopting them. Subject to our engagement with the United Kingdom’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) and in line with the  commitments we have offered, Chrome could then phase out third-party cookies over a three month period, starting in mid-2023 and ending in late 2023.”
  The delay gives the adtech industry more time to adapt to a post-tracking-cookie online realm — assuming the CMA is happy to let Google go ahead with the major retooling.
  Adtech giant Google appears to be leaning toward postponing a long planned deprecation of third party tracking cookies.
 The  plan dates back to 2019 when it  announced the  long-term initiative that will make it harder for online marketers and advertisers to track web users, including by deprecating third party cookies in Chrome.
 Then in  January 2020 it said it would make the switch within two years. Which would mean by 2022.
  Google confirmed to TechCrunch that it has a Privacy Sandbox announcement incoming today — set for 4pm BST/5pm CET — after we contacted it to ask for confirmation of information we’d heard, via our own sources.
 We’ve been told Google’s new official timeline for implementation will be 2023.
 However a spokesman for the tech giant danced around providing a direct confirmation — saying that “an update” is incoming shortly.
 “We do have an announcement today that will shed some light on Privacy Sandbox updates,” the spokesman also told us.
 He had responded to our initial email — which had asked Google to confirm that it will postpone the implementation of Privacy Sandbox to 2023; and for any statement on the delay — with an affirmation (“yep”) so, well, a delay looks likely. But we’ll see how exactly Google will spin that in a few minutes when it publishes the incoming Privacy Sandbox announcement.
 Google has previously said it would deprecate support for third party cookies by 2022 — which naturally implies that the wider Privacy Sandbox stack of related adtech would also need to be in place by then.
 Earlier this year it slightly hedged the 2022 timeline, saying in  January that any changes would not be made before 2022.
 The issue for Google is that regulatory scrutiny of its plan has stepped up — following antitrust complaints from the adtech industry which faces huge changes to how it can track and target Internet users.
 In Europe, the UK’s Competition and Markets Authority has been working with the UK’s Information Commissioner’s Office to understand the competition and privacy implications of Google’s planned move. And,  earlier this month, the CMA issued a notification of intention to accept proposed commitments from Google that would enable the regulator to block any deprecation of cookies if it’s not happy it can be done in a way that’s good for competition and privacy.
 At the time we asked Google how the CMA’s involvement might impact the Privacy Sandbox timeline but the company declined to comment.
 Increased regulatory oversight of Big Tech will have plenty of ramifications — most obviously it means the end of any chance for giants like Google to ‘move fast and break things’.
title: 更新：谷歌延迟了折旧跟踪饼干
title_en: Update: Google is delaying its deprecation of tracking cookies

note: 但它是2021年，没有ILL事件即将到来，所以我们正在带回现场表演，但在霍普岛上。 这意味着无论你在哪里，你都可以摇摆，与我们谈谈一下，评论中的巨魔Danny，一般都有一个美好的时光，因为我们试图记住如何成为魅力。  而且你将能够看到克里斯和恩典之前记录的节目削减了您在我们发出的完成版本中错过的所有尴尬错误，UMS，暂停和其他Shenanigans。  当然，它是免费的，所以请点击这里注册。 如果它进展顺利，我们可能会做得更多。 所以，如果你是免费的话，请做摇摆。 我们很乐意见到你。
note_en:
But it’s 2021 and there are no IRL events coming up, so we’re bringing back the live show, but on  Hopin. That means that no matter where you are, you can swing by, talk a little shit with us, troll Danny in the comments, and generally have a good time as we try to remember how to be charismatic.
  And you will be able to see the show recorded before Chris and Grace cut out all the awkward mistakes, ums, pauses, and other shenanigans that you miss in the finished versions that we send out.
  It’s free, of course, so click  here to register.  If it goes well, we’ll probably get to do more. So, please do swing by if you are free. We’d love to see you.
title: 注册以观察股票播客的Livestream录制！
title_en: Register to watch a livestream recording of the Equity podcast!

note:
Sagi Eliyahu，Tonkean的联合创始人兼首席执行官在面试中告诉TechCrunch，他的公司估值在其最新资金上升了4倍。
 启动能够以更高的价格确保更多的资本，因为在2020年的快速增长，Eliyahu表示集中在2020年的下半年。
  Tonkean是业务流程自动化，无代码和人类的有趣组合。简而言之，启动允许公司的OPS组 - 销售OPS，营销ops等 - 在可以包括循环元素的应用程序中设置自动业务逻辑。和Tonkean建立了它的系统，以其是友好的，允许它支持企业级客户。
 自动化空间最近的季度广泛热。机器人过程自动化（RPA）对于机械化重复的任务是浪费人类时间的重复任务。使用计算机来做人类以前不得不通过点击太多而做的东西来做东西的方法已经被证明是大企业。
   Tonkean允许有点不同的东西。一个例子可能有所帮助：在我们的采访中，Eliyahu如果一个Tonkean客户想要派出培育运动，那么如果一个销售人员将发生的情况发生了什么。 Tonkean会让销售ops团队设置逻辑，以便当前线销售人员选择领先的培养力量在其CRM内部时，潜在客户将自动添加到特定的市场活动中。此外，点击培养系统将提醒人类在销售团队上，也许要求批准该决定。
 Tonkean软件使用禁令工具来让Ops组使用现成的命令模块来构建业务逻辑 - 或根据需要制作自己的工艺。公司的软件的使用可以允许更多授权的公司，这些公司在工程集团依赖于依赖工程群体，以获得加速和自动化工作。
 在一般来说，我们在从无代码初创公司中看到的一般叙述内容：他们希望允许非技术人员通过较少依赖于他们就业地点的技术团队来更加控制他们的工作。 
Tonkean今天雇用了大约60人，在其系列时从大约15名人员乘坐A.它计划迅速雇用它，因为它有更多的资本。 Eliyahu声称其大部分系列仍在银行中。 那为什么会提高？  因为Eliyahu认为他的初创公司的市场如此之大，以至于他想要将公司的未来拉到今天; 新资本将给予Tonkean，它需要更快地雇用的空间，并且如果它继续从较小的资本案件中运营的情况比它可能拥有更快的速度。  五六万美元是很多钱。 让我们看看它有多远tonkean。 下次与公司交谈时，我们将需要一些更难的增长指标，以便我们可以看出额外的资本是公司希望它的促进。
note_en:
Sagi Eliyahu, Tonkean’s co-founder and CEO, told TechCrunch in an interview that his company’s valuation rose by around 4x in its latest funding round.
 The startup was able to secure more capital at a higher price thanks in part to quick growth in 2020, which Eliyahu said was concentrated in the second half of 2020.
  Tonkean is an interesting mix of business process automation, no-code and humans. In short, the startup allows a company’s ops groups — sales ops, marketing ops, etc. — to set up automated business logic across applications that can include human-in-the-loop elements. And Tonkean built its system to be IT-friendly, allowing it to support enterprise-scale customers.
 The automation space has been broadly hot in recent quarters. Robotic process automation (RPA) is great for mechanizing repetitive tasks that waste human time. The method of using computers to do stuff that humans previously had to do by clicking far too much has  proven to be big business.
   Tonkean allows for something a bit different. An example may help: During our interview, Eliyahu mused about what might happen if a salesperson for a Tonkean client wanted to send a lead into a nurture campaign. Tonkean would let the sales ops team set up logic so that when the frontline salesperson selects the lead for a nurture effort inside their CRM, the lead would then automatically be added to a specific Marketo campaign. Furthermore, the click-to-nurture system would alert a human on the sales team, perhaps asking for approval of the decision.
 Tonkean software employs no-code tools to let ops groups use off-the-shelf command modules to build business logic — or craft their own as needed. The use of the company’s software could allow for more empowered teams at companies that are less reliant on engineering groups for help in accelerating and automating their work.
 That thematically fits inside the general narrative we’ve seen from no-code startups in general: They want to allow non-technical folks to have more control of their work through less reliance on technical teams at their place of employment.
 Tonkean employs around 60 people today, up from around 15 folks at the time of its Series A. It plans to hire rapidly now that it has more capital. Eliyahu claims most of its Series A is still in the bank. So why did it raise?
 Because Eliyahu considers his startup’s market to be so large that he wants to pull the company’s future closer to today; the new capital will give Tonkean the space it needs to hire more rapidly and build more quickly than it might have if it continued to operate from a smaller capital case.
 Fifty million dollars is a lot of money. Let’s see how far it gets Tonkean. The next time we talk to the company, we’ll demand some harder growth metrics so we can see if the additional capital was the accelerant that the company hopes it will be.
title: Tonkean培养了5000万系列B，加速是没有代码商业自动化服务
title_en: Tonkean raises $50M Series B to accelerate is no-code business automation service
